intro: Diplycosia stellaris, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater habitats. The leaves are alternate, palmately lobed, and often have a velvety texture.
